block.p: Calvin Sims of The New York Times talks with Mayor Antonio R. Villaraigosa of Los Angeles about his political goals, the city's racial tensions and the lingering question of which is better: New York or Los Angeles.
On being the first Latino mayor of Los Angeles in more than a century: ''It says a lot more about the people of Los Angeles than it does about me.''
On Los Angeles as the gang capital of the United States: ''We have 9,400 police officers for four million people, 456 square miles of city.''
